wikipedia_page.main: Robert Norman William Blake, Baron Blake,  (23 December 1916 – 20 September 2003), was an English historian and peer. He is best known for his 1966 biography of Benjamin Disraeli, and for The Conservative Party from Peel to Churchill, which grew out of his 1968 Ford lectures.

response: * Robert Blake, Baron Blake (1916–2003), English historian

A collateral relative was the historian Robert Blake, Baron Blake (1916–2003).Morgan, Kenneth O. "Blake, Robert Norman William, Baron Blake (1916–2003)". Oxford Dictionary of National Biography (online ed.). Oxford University Press. doi:10.1093/ref:odnb/92619.
